NavigatorUADataGetHighEntropyValues.summary: The getHighEntropyValues() method of the interface is a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a dictionary object containing the high entropy values the user-agent returns.

blockquote.para:
Note: The terms high entropy and low entropy refer to the amount of information these values reveal about the browser.
The values returned as properties are deemed low entropy, and unlikely to identify a user.
The values returned by could potentially reveal more information.
These values are therefore retrieved via a , allowing time for the browser to request user permission, or make other checks.

remarks.para:
-These values are also available as via HTTP request headers:-Low-entropy client hints) are sent automatically:-Sec-CH-UA
-Sec-CH-UA-Mobile
-Sec-CH-UA-Platform
-Servers can request to receive high-entropy client hints on subsequent requests, using the Accept-CH header:-Sec-CH-UA-Arch
-Sec-CH-UA-Bitness
-Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version
-Sec-CH-UA-Model
-Sec-CH-UA-Platform-Version

NavigatorUADataGetHighEntropyValues.returns: A that resolves to an object containing some or all of the following values (based on the hints requested):
